multivariate: What type of feature transformation was used?
What type of feature selection was used?
What type of dimension reduction was used?
Provide dimension before and after any feature selection and/or dimension reduction
Information on how the target values relate to the population. Specify how this is taken into account in the predictive model
Assumptions made on the covariance structure
For kernel-based methods (i.e. SVM) report type of kernel used, type and number of parameters needed to be estimated
Parameter settings, those fixed and those estimated; specify how fixed parameter values were chosen
How the convergence of the learning method is monitored
Pipeline structure applied uniformly to all cases (e.g. that could be independently applied to a new case)
Report receiver operating characteristic curves and area under the curve.
For representational similarity analysis, report the Kendall Tau statistic for each candidate model considered.
When possible use formal test to obtain P­value to assess whether evaluation metric is “significant” or consistent with noise.
Procedure used to interpret the fit of the classifier, identifying the relative importance of the features (e.g. the weight vector in linear discriminant).
results: Provide a complete list of tested and omitted effects
Size of the analysis volume in voxels

For connectivty ICA based methods, report the total number of components (especially when estimated from the data and not fixed). Report the number of these analyzed and the reason for their selection
For connectivty graph-based methods, carefully state what is the null hypothesis of the test and how the statistic distribution under the null is computed
For multivariate, report optimised evaluation metrics
data_sharing: List types of images and non­imaging data provided
Report on the completeness of the data
Specific instructions on how to gain access to the data.

Clarify any constraints on uses of shared data.
Provide URL to documentation, and specify its scope
Report the format of the image data shared.
Data organization structures, including Data Dictionaries and Schemas.

Availability of in-resource visualization of the imaging or non­imaging data
How, if at all, data are de-identified ?
Availability of detailed provenance of preprocessing and analysis of shared data
Ability of a repository to work in a multi-database environment, availability of API’s and ability to connect to analysis pipelines
Mechanisms available for constructing queries on the repository (e.g. SQL, SPARQL)
How users can check version of downloaded data and compare it to the current version at a later time
